akn:content.akn:p: Any person who knows, or has reasonable cause to believe, that a child is a victim of sexual abuse shall immediately report such knowledge or belief to the police. For the purposes of this subchapter, a call to 911, or a report to the Child and Family Services Agency, shall be deemed a report to the police.

Any person who is or has been a victim of sexual abuse is not required to report pursuant to subsection (a) of this section if the identity of the alleged perpetrator matches the identity of the victim’s abuser.
No legally recognized privilege, except for the following, shall apply to this subchapter:
This section should not be construed as altering the special duty to report by persons specified in § 4-1321.02(b).
